basic_ml_yield_request.query: Deep learning approaches for predicting crop yields
basic_ml_yield_request.ranking_guidance: Prioritize recent studies and empirical evaluations.

queries.query: "title:(machine learning) AND abstract:(crop yield prediction)"
"title:(artificial intelligence OR AI) AND abstract:(crop production OR agricultural yield) AND keywords:(forecasting OR prediction)"
machine learning crop yield prediction
applications of artificial intelligence in agriculture yield
title:("crop yield") AND abstract:("deep learning" OR "machine learning")
title:("yield prediction") AND abstract:("convolutional neural networks" OR "recurrent neural networks")
"Deep learning crop yield prediction"
"Machine learning for crop yield forecasting"

ranked_papers.title: Crop Yield Prediction using Machine Learning and  Deep Learning Techniques
authors: Venkata Rama Rao Kolipaka, et al.
ranked_papers.analysis: This paper, published in October 2023, directly addresses the research query on deep learning approaches for crop yield prediction. The paper's focus aligns well with the user's ranking guidance, as it is a recent study. It explores various machine learning and deep learning techniques, including CNN, RNN, LSTM, and Bi-GRU, for predicting crop yields. The methodology involves examining the application of classifiers, CNN, RNN, Bi-GRU, Maxout classifiers, LSTM, and optimization algorithms. The evidence presented includes discussions on how these techniques are applied and their potential benefits in crop yield prediction. The paper also discusses the limitations of these approaches. The direct relevance is high, as the study's objectives are aligned with the research query and its analysis of different DL techniques is valuable. The paper's recency further enhances its relevance.
relevant_quotes: "Machine Learning or ML and Deep Learning or DL methods have been seen to be extremely important for data analysis and predictions."
"The study would lead to an extensive analysis of the different kinds of Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques used for increasing the crop yields by prediction analysis."
"Each of such techniques helps to make model decision-making and examine each of the factors that have a direct impact on the growth and development of the crops [4]."

"In the case of Bidirectional GRU or Bi GRU, there is the application of two GRUs. One takes in information to move in the forward direction and the other integrates the data for the previous hidden layer."

"With the help of such skip connection procedure, the gradation of the information can be done which allows the preservation of the information. In such a manner, during the forecasting of crop productivity, necessary information regarding the traits and the attributes of the information will not be lost or diluted during the transmission of information."

ranked_papers.title: A CNN-RNN Framework for Crop Yield Prediction
ranked_papers.analysis: This paper is highly relevant to the research query on deep learning approaches for predicting crop yields, especially considering the user's ranking guidance for recent studies and empirical evaluations. The paper presents a novel deep learning framework that combines Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) for crop yield prediction. The study uses empirical data from the United States Corn Belt (2016-2018) to evaluate the model's performance against other machine learning techniques such as Random Forest (RF), Deep Fully Connected Neural Networks (DFNN), and LASSO. The CNN-RNN model achieved superior results in predicting corn and soybean yields, outperforming the other methods. The methodology is well-defined, and the results are supported by statistical analysis. The paper also includes an in-depth analysis of feature importance, which enhances the understanding of the factors influencing yield prediction. However, the study is limited to the Corn Belt region and specific crop types (corn and soybean), which may affect the generalizability of the findings to other regions or crops. Also, the reliance on historical data for training limits the model's ability to incorporate real-time data or dynamic changes. The study addresses the query directly by proposing and evaluating a deep learning framework for crop yield prediction and comparing its performance to other machine learning methods. The paper's publication date of January 2020 aligns with the user's interest in recent studies.
relevant_quotes: "This paper presents a deep learning framework using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for crop yield prediction based on environmental data and management practices."

"The proposed CNN-RNN model, along with other popular methods such as random forest (RF), deep fully connected neural networks (DFNN), and LASSO, was used to forecast corn and soybean yield across the entire Corn Belt (including 13 states) in the United States for years 2016, 2017, and 2018 using historical data."
"The new model achieved a root-mean-square-error (RMSE) 9% and 8% of their respective average yields, substantially outperforming all other methods that were tested."
"The CNN-RNN model was designed to capture the time dependencies of environmental factors and the genetic improvement of seeds over time without having their genotype information."
"To make the proposed model less of a black box and more explainable, feature selection was performed based on the trained CNN-RNN model using the backpropagation method."

vertical farming urban agriculture effectiveness

config_override_request.query: Sustainable irrigation techniques for rice cultivation
config_override_request.ranking_guidance: Emphasize papers that discuss water-saving technologies in rice farming.

queries.query: title:(sustainable irrigation) AND abstract:(rice cultivation OR paddy farming)
title:("water management" AND "rice") AND abstract:(techniques OR methods)
sustainable irrigation rice cultivation
techniques for water management in rice farming

ranked_papers.title: Sustainable irrigation management in tropical lowland rice in Brazil.
ranked_papers.analysis: This paper is highly relevant to the research query "Sustainable irrigation techniques for rice cultivation" and directly addresses the user's ranking guidance to emphasize papers discussing water-saving technologies in rice farming. The study utilizes the SWAP/WOFOST model to simulate the performance of rice cultivation under different irrigation treatments (flooding, water-saving, and rainfed) and rainfall regimes. The methodology is strong, employing a calibrated and validated hydrological model to assess water productivity and grain yield. The evidence presented is of good quality, based on simulations and model validation against experimental data. A key strength is the comparison of flood irrigation with water-saving techniques, directly addressing the query. The study's limitations include the absence of data on groundwater level and the simplification of soil water fluxes. The paper's direct relevance stems from its focus on water-saving irrigation, its impact on water productivity, and its recommendation of water-saving irrigation methods based on crop transpiration for increasing water use efficiency. The research is focused on the Brazilian Cerrado region, which provides location-specific insights, but the general findings regarding water-saving irrigation techniques are broadly applicable.
relevant_quotes: "Recent studies have shown the advantages of adopting water-saving irrigation in the region but a comprehensive assessment is needed."
"Results suggest that saving irrigation based on crop transpiration can reduce deep percolation losses and increase water productivity in the rice-growing areas of the Brazilian Cerrado."
"Choosing the water-saving irrigation method rather than the flood irrigation method increases water productivity by about 10 % and penalizes the rice grain yield by 5–13 %."

"Hence, as an alternative to the traditional method of flood irrigation employed in South Brazil, a more sustainable irrigation method based on crop transpiration is recommended for increasing the water use efficiency of rice production in Northern Brazil."

ranked_papers.title: Sustainable Small Scale Irrigation Experiment in the Dry Zones: A Case Study on Happa ( Small Tank) Model in the State of West Bengal, India.
ranked_papers.analysis: This paper is highly relevant to the research query on sustainable irrigation techniques for rice cultivation, particularly emphasizing water-saving technologies, as per the user's ranking guidance. The study focuses on a 'happa' (small tank) model for irrigation in the dry zones of West Bengal, India. The methodology involves a case study approach with primary surveys of households, cost-benefit analysis, and assessment of ecological and social impacts. The evidence is based on field data, including crop yields, cropping patterns, and household characteristics. While the study is limited to a specific geographical area (Biradihi village) and a specific irrigation technique (happa), it provides valuable insights into the economic viability and sustainability of small-scale irrigation. The paper directly addresses the research query by exploring a water-saving irrigation method and its impact on crop production, especially paddy, highlighting its benefits and potential for upscaling. The paper explicitly discusses the impact of the 'happa' model on crop yields, cropping intensity, and water conservation, which aligns well with the research query's focus on sustainable irrigation techniques in rice farming. The study acknowledges the importance of water conservation and the need for sustainable irrigation practices. The paper is focused on the dry zone so water-saving is paramount.
relevant_quotes: “Sustainable Small Scale Irrigation Experiment in the Dry Zones: A Case Study on Happa ( Small Tank) Model in the State of West Bengal, India.”
“In this backdrop, there is an urgent need to explore the possibilities of sustainable and innovative forms of irrigation.”
“A happa is a mud-excavated small water harvesting structure with the average size of 50ft× 45ft×12 ft.”
“Economic benefits include incremental production from paddy production and vegetable production through irrigation.”
“Farmers could provide life saving irrigation to paddy crop during this khariff season.”

platform_specific_arxiv_request.query: Novel neural network architectures for image recognition
platform_specific_arxiv_request.ranking_guidance: Favor papers proposing new architectures over applications of existing ones. Focus on computer science venues.

queries.query: "neural network" AND "image recognition" AND "novel architectures"
"deep learning" AND "computer vision" AND "new network designs"

ranked_papers.title:
Video-TransUNet: Temporally Blended Vision Transformer for CT VFSS
  Instance Segmentation
ranked_papers.analysis: The paper, "Video-TransUNet: Temporally Blended Vision Transformer for CT VFSS Instance Segmentation," introduces a novel deep learning architecture for instance segmentation in medical CT videos. The methodology integrates temporal feature blending into the TransUNet framework, incorporating a ResNet CNN backbone, a Temporal Context Module (TCM), a Vision Transformer, and a UNet-based convolutional-deconvolutional architecture. This approach aligns well with the research query regarding novel neural network architectures. The paper's evidence is based on experiments on the VFSS2022 dataset, demonstrating superior performance compared to existing state-of-the-art segmentation approaches, suggesting a strong quality of evidence. Limitations include the specific application domain (medical CT videos) and the potential for generalization to other image recognition tasks. The paper directly addresses the research query by proposing a new architecture that combines CNNs, transformers, and temporal context modules. The architecture favors proposing new methods since it is a new architecture that introduces a new temporal blending component within the TransUNet structure. The use of a Vision Transformer is a key aspect of the design.
relevant_quotes: We propose Video-TransUNet, a deep architecture for instance segmentation in medical CT videos constructed by integrating temporal feature blending into the TransUNet deep learning framework.

In particular, our approach amalgamates strong frame representation via a ResNet CNN backbone, multi-frame feature blending via a Temporal Context Module (TCM), non-local attention via a Vision Transformer, and reconstructive capabilities for multiple targets via a UNet-based convolutional-deconvolutional architecture with multiple heads.

We show that this new network design can signiﬁcantly outperform other state-of-the-art systems when tested on the segmentation of bolus and pharynx/larynx in Videoﬂuoroscopic Swallowing Study (VFSS) CT sequences.

For the ﬁrst time we extend a UNet-like architecture (i.e. TransUNet) via temporal feature blending that exploits information from across neighbouring frames via attention for more accurate segmentation.

ranked_papers.title: Designing Network Design Strategies Through Gradient Path Analysis
ranked_papers.analysis: This paper is highly relevant to the research query "Novel neural network architectures for image recognition". It proposes new network design strategies based on gradient path analysis, which directly addresses the user's preference for papers proposing novel architectures. The paper introduces three new design strategies: layer-level, stage-level, and network-level, and provides experimental results on object detection and instance segmentation, demonstrating improvements over baseline methods. The methodology is well-defined, with clear explanations of the proposed strategies and experimental setup. The evidence quality is good, with ablation studies and comparisons to existing architectures. A limitation is the focus on the gradient path, which might increase programming difficulty. The paper's direct relevance is high, as it provides new architectural designs, and the experimental evaluation on computer vision tasks aligns well with the query. The paper’s focus is on devising new architectures, rather than applying existing ones which matches user ranking guidance.
relevant_quotes: "This paper proposes a new network design strategy, i.e., to design the network architecture based on gradient path analysis."
"In this paper, we hope to enhance the expressive ability of the trained model by improving the network learning ability."

"We propose the gradient path design strategies for the layer-level, the stage-level, and the network-level, and the design strategies are proved to be superior and feasible from theoretical analysis and experiments."
"In this paper we divide network design strategies into two kinds: (1) data path design strategies, and (2) gradient path design strategies, as shown in Figure 2."

"In this paper we propose a strategy for designing network architectures with gradient paths. We propose three different gradient path design strategies and these strategies confirm that no matter designing from layer-level, stage-level, or network-level, it can effectively and comprehensively improve the network architecture to achieve great learning ability."
